resources.string: Please enter user name and password for retroachievements.org below. Your password will not be saved in DuckStation, an access token will be generated and used instead.
Your login token for retroachievements.org has expired. You must log in again. Your password will not be saved in DuckStation.
You have unlocked %1$d of %2$d achievements, earning %3$d of %4$d possible points.
Unlocked: %1$s | %2$.1f%% of players have this achievement
No vibrators found. Your controller or driver may not support vibration.
"Are you sure you want to remove the BIOS named '%s'? This action is permanent."
Failed to delete BIOS image. You may have to manually remove it.
No BIOS images found, you must import one first.
Are you sure you wish to delete this save state? It cannot be recovered.
Automatic mapping complete. You may still need to adjust some bindings.
No suitable devices found. Automatic binding only supports gamepad devices, but you can still bind other device types manually.

"Press button on controller to set new binding.
Current Binding: %s"
Are you sure you want to clear all bindings? This cannot be reversed.
A game must be running to change this setting.
This will reset all controller settings, including the touchscreen. Do you want to continue?
Attempts to automatically bind all buttons/axes to a connected controller.
Unbinds all buttons/axes for this controller.
The selected device does not support vibration.
You must enter a card name.
"Failed to create one or more directories, can't continue."
Transferring data allows you to easily move saves and game settings from one device to another. Do you want to transfer to/from a zip file, or a folder?
Exporting data will save it to the zip/folder. Importing data will add it into this DuckStation installation.
"The file '%s' already exists, do you want to overwrite? Any existing data will be lost."

"In the form below, specify the URLs to download covers from, with one template URL per line. The following variables are available:
${title}: Title of the game. ${filetitle}: Name component of the game's filename. ${serial}: Serial of the game."
One or more URLs contains no variables.

"Enter the full path to the directory with games.
You can get this from a file manager app.
Example: /storage/emulated/0/games"

"WARNING: Your game is still saving to the memory card. Continuing to %1$s may IRREVERSIBLY DESTROY YOUR MEMORY CARD. We recommend resuming your game and waiting 5 seconds for it to finish saving.
Do you want to %1$s anyway?"

"Using patch codes can have unpredictable effects on games, causing crashes, graphical glitches, and corrupted saves. By using patch codes, you agree that it is an unsupported configuration, and we will not provide you with any assistance when games break.
Some codes persist through save states even after being disabled, please remember to reset/reboot the game after turning off any codes.
Are you sure you want to continue?"
Failed to save screenshot to temporary location.
Are you sure you want to delete the cover image for this game? It cannot be recovered.
No memory cards found for this game.
Do you want to clear or set a new background image?
Removes any manually-added codes for this game.
Disables any codes that are currently enabled.
Edits a single manually entered code.
Enabling this option will enable any codes selected below to be applied.
Failed to parse game settings ini.
Patch codes can be imported directly from text, or from files in various formats. Please choose the type of codes to import.
Adds additional codes from a user-provided file or text.
Enables loading codes from the database that is built-in to DuckStation.
No patch codes are available for this game.
Using patch codes can have unpredictable effects on games, causing crashes, graphical glitches, and corrupted saves.
No patches are available for this game.
No manually entered codes found. To hide built-in codes, toggle the \"Load Database Codes\" option.
Removes a single manually entered code.

"You are removing all patch codes manually added for this game. This action cannot be reversed.
Any database cheats will still be loaded and present unless you uncheck the \"Load Database Cheats\" option.
Are you sure you want to continue?"
Enabling any codes will not have any effect until game settings are enabled. Do you want to do this now?
Enabling this code will not have any effect until codes are enabled for this game. Do you want to do this now?
Any settings currently set for this game will be removed. Are you sure you want to continue?
Any settings currently set for this game will be overwritten. Are you sure you want to continue?
Checks if your disc image matches the known valid dumps database.
Clears all settings set for this game.
Copies the current global settings to this game.
Uses separate game settings for each disc of multi-disc games. Can only be set on the first/main disc.
This game has %d leaderboards. Submission requires hardcore mode.
Replaces the current settings with the settings from a profile.
Loading an input profile will overwrite your current layout/bindings. Do you want to continue?
BIOS image is too large. You must select a BIOS image, not a game, and it should be 512KB in size.

"Supported formats are:
%s
Games in bin format require a cuesheet (.cue) to start."
No games were found. Please add a directory with games to begin.
Cannot create shortcut. Make sure your launcher supports it.
This BIOS image is invalid, or has already been imported.
"No BIOS image was found in DuckStation's bios directory. A PS1 or PS2 BIOS image is required to play games. Do you wish to locate and import a BIOS image now?"
Switch to clock mode for the time input.
Switch to text input mode for the time input.
This file requires %1$d blocks, but only %2$d blocks are free.
"Failed to read file '%s' from source card."
"Failed to write file '%s' to destination card."
"Memory card '%s' will be deleted, and cannot be recovered. Are you sure you want to delete this card?"
"Are you sure you want to delete the save '%s'?"
Failed to open or read memory card.
"Memory card '%s' will be formatted, clearing all saves. Are you sure you want to format this card?"
"Importing '%1$s' will remove all saves in '%2$s'. Do you want to continue?"
"Failed to import card '%s'. It may not be a supported format."
Failed to import card. It may not be a supported format.
Must have at least two cards open to copy.
"Are you sure you want to permanently delete the save '%s'? You cannot recover the save afterwards."
"Failed to undelete save '%s'. The save may already be partially overwritten."
"A memory card named '%s' already exists. Do you want to overwrite it? Any existing data will be lost."
Imports a memory card from storage.
Quick swaps the memory cards in port 1 and 2.
Start date selection: %1$s â€“ End date selection: %2$s
Tap to switch to Calendar view
Tap to switch to year view
Per-game controller configuration initialized with global settings.

"Additional GLSL and ReShade shaders can be added in [storage]/Android/data/com.github.stenzek.duckstation/files/shaders. Additional border overlays can be added in [storage]/Android/data/com.github.stenzek.duckstation/files/resources/overlays."
This will remove all shaders from the chain. Their configuration cannot be recovered. Are you sure you want to clear all shaders?
This shader does not have any configurable options.
Adds a new shader to the chain.
Removes all shaders from the chain.
Applies the post-processing chain configured below.
Moves this shader down in the application order.
Moves this shader up in the application order.
Removes this shader from the post-processing pipeline.
Resume save state does not exist.
"Do you want to load the automatic save created at %s? "
Saves the current settings to a profile, which can be chosen per-game.
No save present in this slot.
Selecting Yes will reset all settings to defaults. You will not be able to recover any changes.
After logging out, no more achievements will be unlocked until you log back in again. Achievements already unlocked will not be lost.
DuckStation uses RetroAchievements (retroachievements.org) as an achievement database and for tracking progress.
Allows you bind external controller buttons/axises to the emulated controller.
Forces blending to be done in the shader at 16-bit precision, when not using true color. Non-trivial performance impact, and unnecessary for most games.
Displays popup messages on events such as achievement unlocks and leaderboard submissions.
Challenge mode for achievements, including leaderboard tracking. Disables save state, cheats, and slowdown functions.
When enabled and logged in, DuckStation will scan for achievements on startup.
When enabled, each session will behave as if no achievements have been unlocked.
Displays popup messages when starting, submitting, or failing a leaderboard challenge.
Logs in to your account to record achievements.
Logs out of your account. No new achievements will be recorded.
Shows icons in the lower-right corner of the screen when a challenge/primed achievement is active.
Opens a link to create a new account.
Plays sound effects for events such as achievement unlocks and leaderboard submissions.
When enabled, DuckStation will assume all achievements are locked and not send any unlock notifications to the server.
When enabled, DuckStation will list achievements from unofficial sets. Please note that these achievements are not tracked by RetroAchievements, so they unlock every time.
Opens a link to your profile.
Automatically disable enhancements when they are not supported by games.
Enables loading of per-game configuration. If this option is disabled, only the global configuration will be used.
Determines the target amount of audio buffered. Smaller buffers reduce latency, but increase requirements.
Hides the touchscreen controller when an external controller is detected.
Binds touchscreen swipe gestures to the emulated right stick.
Sets the emulated cycles for reads/seeks when using the Maximum speedup setting.
Prevents discs from incorrect regions being read by the emulator. Usually safe to disable.
Smooths out blockyness between colour transitions in 24-bit content, usually FMVs.
Patches the BIOS to skip the boot animation. Safe to enable.
Fast forwards through the early loading process when fast booting, saving time. Results may vary between games.
Fast forwards through memory card access, both loading and saving. Can reduce waiting times in games that frequently access memory cards.
Logs debug messages printed by games.
Copies the global controller configuration (including touchscreen) to this game.
Enables the generated code to directly jump between blocks without going through the dispatcher. Provides a measurable speed boost.
Makes guest memory access more efficient by using page faults and backpatching. Disable if it is unstable on your device.
"Determines whether the CPU's instruction cache is simulated in the recompiler. Improves accuracy at a small cost to performance. If games are running too fast, try enabling this option."
Used when aspect ratio is set to Custom.
Deletes a BIOS that was previously imported.
Prevents the use of the dual-source blending extensions.
Prevents the use of the framebuffer fetch extensions.
Prevents the caching of shaders, forcing them to be recompiled every time.
Prevents the use of the texture/shader storage buffers. Will reduce performance.
Always copies through the shadow texture. Will reduce performance.
Stretches the active display to fill the screen.
Adds 6MB extra RAM to the emulated system. Games have to be modified to utilize the additional memory.
Forces the controller to analog mode when the console is reset/powered on.
"Forwards rumble from the game to the phone's vibration motor."
Expands the display area to include the cutout (or notch) area.
"Controls the volume of the emulator's sound output when fast forwarding."
Switches back to 4:3 display aspect ratio when displaying 24-bit content, usually FMVs.
Change the list of directories used to search for games.
"Adjusts the emulation speed so the console's refresh rate matches the host."
Uses a second thread for drawing graphics. Speed boost, and safe to use.
Import a new BIOS file not currently in this list.
Automatically applies patches to disc images when they are present, currently only PPF is supported.
Writes log messages to duckstation.log in your user directory. Only use for debugging as it slows down emulation.
Writes log messages to the Android message logger. Only useful when attached to a computer with adb.
Prevents the emulator from emitting any sound.
Forcibly mutes both CD-DA and XA audio from the CD-ROM. Can be used to disable background music in some games.
Enables the older, less accurate MDEC decoding routines. May be required for old replacement backgrounds to match/load.
Enable this option will ensure every frame the console renders is displayed to the screen, for optimal frame pacing. Also pins the threads to big cores, if any.
Adjusts the margins used for displaying on-screen messages.
Increases or decreases the size of on-screen messages/statistics.
Shows the number of game frames (internal frame rate) and video frames (speed) in the top-right corner of the display.
Shows the current controller state of the system in the bottom-left corner of the display.
Shows on-screen-display messages when events occur such as save states being created/loaded, screenshots being taken, etc.
Shows the resolution the game is rendering at in the top-right corner of the display.
Shows the current emulation speed of the system in the top-right corner of the display as a percentage.
Shows the number of frames (or v-syncs) displayed per second by the system in the top-right corner of the display.
Determines the latency between audio being buffered and output to speakers.
Uses perspective-correct interpolation for colors, which can improve visuals in some games.
Tries to track vertex manipulation through the CPU. Some games require this option for PGXP to be effective. Very high performance penalty.
Increases the precision of polygon culling, reducing the number of holes in geometry.
Reduces polygon Z-fighting through depth testing. Low compatibility with games.
Uses native resolution coordinates for 2D polygons, instead of precise coordinates. Can fix misaligned UI in some games, but otherwise should be left disabled.
Reduces \"wobbly\" polygons and \"warping\" textures that are common in PS1 games. Only works with the hardware renderers.
Adds additional precision to PGXP data post-projection. May improve visuals in some games.
Uses perspective-correct interpolation for texture coordinates, straightening out warped textures.
Uses screen coordinates as a fallback when tracking vertices through memory fails. May improve PGXP compatibility.
Loads the game image into RAM. Useful for network paths that may become unreliable during gameplay.
Preloads replacements to RAM instead of loading on demand. Do not use on low memory devices.
Resets all configuration to defaults (including touchscreen and bindings).
Enables rewinding via touchscreen button/hotkey. Very high hardware requirements, do not use on low end devices.
This number of saves (or frames) will be kept for rewinding.
A rewind save will created each time this interval lapses.
Rounds texture coordinates instead of flooring when upscaling. Can fix misaligned textures in some games, but break others, and is incompatible with texture filtering.
Temporarily disables all enhancements, which can be useful when debugging issues.
Automatically saves the system state when powering down or exiting. You can then resume directly from where you left off next time.
Scales line skipping in interlaced rendering to the internal resolution, making it less noticeable. Usually safe to enable.
Shows the CPU usage based on threads in the top-right corner of the display.
Shows a visual history of frame times in the top-right corner of the display.
Shows information about the emulated GPU in the top-right corner of the display.
Shows the host GPU usage in the top-right corner of the display (may reduce performance).
Shows indicators when running outside normal parameters (e.g. fast forward).
Shows information about input and audio latency in the top-right corner of the display.
Shows a summary of current settings in the bottom-right corner of the display.
"Shows the entirety of the console's VRAM instead of the display area (debugging feature)."
When the game has not rendered a new frame, skips presenting the previous frame to the display. Can improve performance at the cost of frame pacing.
Enables caching of guest textures, required for texture replacement. Experimental, may cause rendering errors in some games.
Enables loading of replacement textures. Not compatible with all games.
Allows you to press multiple controller face buttons by dragging your finger along the screen.
Hides touch controls after the specified time. A delay of zero will not hide the controls.
Adjusts the position for touchscreen buttons.
Controls the transparency level of the touchscreen controller.
Adjusts the scale for touchscreen buttons.
Changes button behavior from hold-to-press to tap-to-press.
"Forwards vibration from the game to your device's vibration motor, if present."
Allows you to use the analog sticks to control the d-pad in digital mode, as well as the buttons.
Enables validation of GPU commands. Slower, but can be used for debugging.
Uses game specific settings for controller and touchscreen configuration for this game.
On some devices and games, this may result in greater performance with the hardware renderer, at the cost of increased battery usage.
Enables a short vibration when a touchscreen button is pressed. Requires \"Vibrate on Touch\" to be enabled on your device.
Throttles the frequency at which vibration updates are sent. May help with controller disconnection/lag issues.
"Synchronizes presentation of the console's frames to the host. Not needed on most devices, and can cause slowdown."
"Controls the volume of the emulator's sound output."
Enables the replacement of background textures in supported games.
Increases the field of view from 4:3 to the chosen display aspect ratio in 3D games.
Adjusts the ratio of touch movement to stick pressure. Lower values imply more stick pressure.
Use Analog Sticks for D-Pad in Digital Mode

DuckStation supports earning achievements and leaderboard tracking with RetroAchievements. If you have a RetroAchievements account, you can use the form below to log in. If not, you can register at https://retroachievements.org/createaccount.php. A RetroAchievements account is NOT required to use the app.

"A PS1 or PS2 BIOS image is required to play games and is not optional. This image should be dumped from your own console, using tools such as Caetla or Unirom. There are plenty of guides available online on how to dump your console's BIOS."
Press finish to open the game list and start scanning for games. If you need to, you can re-run this setup wizard again from within App Settings.
Please read the following instructions before continuing. You can access this FAQ again from the navigation menu in the game list.

DuckStation will automatically detect games in the locations you specify here. You should add at least one directory to scan. Please do not add the top of your storage volume, otherwise scanning will take a very long time.
Some of the most commonly adjusted settings are listed here. You can change these again after setup is complete by swiping the navigation menu from the left.
Just a few setup steps are necessary before you can play games.
Please choose a theme and language, then tap Next to get started.
This will reset all touchscreen layouts, any changes you have made will be lost.
Replaces the current layout with the defaults.

"This DuckStation update includes:
- Performance improvements - Disc changing for bin/cue - Post-processing shaders (GLSL+Reshade) - Enhancement compatibility improvements - New, faster recompiler (NewRec, still experimental) - Switch to rc_client for RetroAchievements - Unify hardware renderers
No configuration changes are required."

"This DuckStation update includes:
- Performance improvements - Multi-threaded rendering - Merging of multi-disc games in list - Game compatibility improvements - Additional controller types - Texture cache and replacement support - New patch code system - CD image verification
No configuration changes are required, but you will need to re-enable any patch codes in Game Properties."

"This DuckStation update includes support for multiple controllers with vibration, and binding devices such as keyboards/volume buttons.
You must re-bind your controllers, otherwise they will no longer function. Do you want to do this now?"

"This DuckStation update includes a new UI and many new functions. Because of scoped storage, you MUST migrate your save data. YOUR SAVE DATA IS NOT LOST, but you must REIMPORT it.
Select Yes, choose the duckstation directory in device storage (swipe menu, you may need to tick it in the top-right overflow), and follow the on-screen prompts.
You can access the data importer again via the swipe menu. Do you want to import now?"
